intro: Phoradendron perfurcatum, commonly known as the flowering shower vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bignoniaceae. It is a climbing shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its long, vine-like stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowering shower vine is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
